column4: can anyone direct me to the right channel for assistance in setting up an ubuntu network?

well, I know with Windows and Mac you can easily set up a network without the use of a server
peer to peer
setting us two desktops and having them communicate
no...just to share info...files and such...although I would like to use the remote desktop app that came with the os
ah...my bad
if you want to make it secure use vnc over ssh
here, but can you be more specific
how do you mean "support networking"
it can access TCP based networks and access routers without need for a server
what are you trying to achieve
do you mean file sharing between 2 systems?
if you have a router / switch and 2 PCs, you have a network
ok we're getting a little closer now. Why are they communicating? What service is one offering to the other?
you can use ssh, file sharing, email access, printer sharing
you need to be specific
ok then you should have said that instead of "set up a network"
if you install and configure samba you can fileshare between any OS
if you want a remote connnection to view the whole desktop you can use VNC
if you want to run the apps on the system and have the display forwarded to the remote system you can use x forwarding
